alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 2:28AM EDT until July 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Grant County in northern Kentucky... Southeastern Owen County in northern Kentucky... Southern Pendleton County in northern Kentucky... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 228 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Falmouth to 12 miles southeast of Owenton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Owenton, Morgan, Corinth, Monterey, Gratz, Goforth, Browning Corner, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Harmony, Cherry Grove, Natlee, Marcus, Keefer, Camp Northward, New Columbus, Elmer Davis Lake and Lawrenceville. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 154. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
